Row.Text: [COLOR_RED]Spending [ICON_Faith] Faith on patronage is disabled by one of your current policies.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_RED]Spending [ICON_Gold] Gold on patronage is disabled by one of your current policies.[ENDCOLOR]
Cannot heal in this territory due to policy selection
You already have an Alliance of this type with another civilization.
{1_OtherCiv} already has an Alliance of this type with another civilization.
View important information about your Alliance Level with this leader, including what Alliance benefits you will have access to.
Propose an Alliance with this power
Propose to extend the duration of your current Alliance with this power
Your current Alliance grants these benefits:
At the next Alliance Level, your Alliances will have these added benefits:
Your ally's cities do not exert Loyalty pressure on yours, and vice versa
Your ally's Religion does not exert Religious pressure on cities dominated by your Religion, and vice versa
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against units of players at war with you and your ally
+4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to your ally
+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from your ally
+2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to your ally
+1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from your ally
+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to your ally
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from your ally
+2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to your ally
+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from your ally
Bonus [ICON_Envoy] Envoy Point for every City State with your ally as Suzerain
+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production toward military units when you or your ally are at war
+10 Religious Combat Strength against non-ally Religions
Every 30 turns (on Standard), you unlock a [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for a tech that your ally has researched or boosted, but you have not
Each of your [ICON_District] Districts grant an additional [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person Point per turn if you have a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route from that city to your ally
Units start with a free Promotion
+1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith for each of your [ICON_Citizen] Citizens following your ally's religion
Bonus Religious Pressure in cities with no followers of your ally's Religion
+10% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science when you or your ally are researching a tech that the other has completed, or are researching the same tech
You gain +20% of your ally's [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from Cities
You gain +10% of your ally's [ICON_Culture] Culture from Cities
Share Suzerain unique bonuses with your ally
[NEWLINE]{1_Amount} Points from having a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to your ally
[NEWLINE]{1_Amount} Points from having a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route from your ally
[NEWLINE]{1_Amount} Points from declaring war on a common enemy
[NEWLINE]{1_Amount} Points from your ally's other sources
+1 to all yields for each government building and palace in a city.
All land melee, anti-cavalry, and naval melee class units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
All cities with a district receive +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity.
+5 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in Theological Combat.[NEWLINE]+0.5 [ICON_Faith] Faith per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in cities with [ICON_Governor] Governors.
+10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in all cities with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor.
All units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. War Weariness reduced by 15%.
+0.6 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in cities with [ICON_Governor] Governors.
REPLACE GOVERNOR? Slotting this governor will replace the governor in this city.
Loyalty per turn with this Governor Established
The selected promotion will not be applied if you leave this screen. Do you want to proceed?
Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_DEFENDER_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats.

Skilled in gaining support for your civilization, and spreading its influence to nearby cities. {LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_AMBASSADOR_NAME} is the only governor that can be given foreign assignment in a city-state.

Spiritual and Religious leader that can increase the [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength of a city, and the Religious units stationed there. {LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_CARDINAL_NAME} is a beacon of [ICON_FAITH] Faith in your empire.

Enterprising and capable, {LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_RESOURCE_MANAGER_NAME} is able to procure valuable resources when needed. He is also quite skilled in optimizing the overall [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in the city.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_EDUCATOR_NAME} is focused on the cultivation of [ICON_SCIENCE] Scientific and [ICON_Culture] Cultural endeavors in the city. He is also quite skilled in the attraction of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People to his city.
Shrewd and fiscally knowledgeable, {LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_MERCHANT_NAME} is able to strengthen the economic power of a city, using finances to provide more than is normally possible.

An expert in efficiency, {LOC_GOVERNOR_THE_BUILDER_NAME} is skilled in all things related to building and construction. An expert planner, she can also supervise the development of custom improvements in the city.
Increases city garrison [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength by +5.
Units defending within the city's territory get +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
City gains an additional [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strike per turn.
Enemy Spies operate at 2 levels below normal in this city.
City cannot be put under siege.
+25 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to anti-air support units within the city's territory when defending against aircraft and ICBMs.
Can be assigned to a city-state, where she acts as 2 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
The influence of nearby cities would apply {1_LoyaltyPerTurnAmount} Loyalty per turn to a new city settled here. Consider using a [ICON_Governor] Governor in the new city, or settling elsewhere.
Other cities within 9 tiles and not owned by you lose 2 Loyalty per turn.
Your other cities within 9 tiles gain +2 Loyalty per turn towards your civilization.
While established in a city-state, provides a copy of its Luxury resources to you.
While established in a city-state, doubles the number of [ICON_Envoy] Envoys you have there.
Religious pressure to adjacent cities is 100% stronger from this city.
+10 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in theological combat in tiles of this city.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Holy Site buildings in the city.
[ICON_Governor] Governor's religious units heal fully in one turn in tiles of this city.
City ignores pressure and combat effects from Religions not founded by the [ICON_Governor] Governor's player.
Apostles and Warrior Monks trained in the city receive 1 extra promotion when receiving their first promotion.
+50% yields from plot harvests and feature removals in city.
+20% [ICON_Food] Growth in the city. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes ending here provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food to their starting city.
+20% [ICON_Production] toward Industrial Zone buildings in the city. Settlers trained in the city do not consume a [ICON_Citizen] Population.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production per turn from each Strategic resource in the city.
Strategic resources are not required in the city in order to build resource dependent units.
This city receives [ICON_Production] Production from any Industrial Zones within 6 tiles, not just the first.
All Builders trained in city get +1 build charge.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production towards City Center and Government Plaza buildings.
The Fishery unique improvement can be built in the city on coastal plots. Yields 1 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Food] Food if adjacent to a sea resource.
The City Park unique improvement can be built in the city. Yields 2 Appeal and 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity if adjacent to water.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production towards constructing districts in the city.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production towards Entertainment Complex and Water Park buildings in the city.
15% increase in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture generated by the city.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Theater Square buildings in the city.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Campus buildings in the city.
+100% [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points generated per turn in the city.
30% [ICON_Production] Production increase to all nuclear armament projects in the city.
30% [ICON_Production] Production increase to all space-program projects in the city.
Acquire new tiles in city faster.
Double adjacency bonuses from Commercial Hubs and Harbors in the city.
+3 [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn from each foreign [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route passing through the city.
+3 [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn from all [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes in and out of the city.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn for each [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in the city.
Allows city to purchase districts with [ICON_Gold] Gold.
+100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from Great Works of Art, Music, and Writing in the city.
You can promote or assign a [ICON_Governor] Governor!
Likes civs that have lots of corps and armies
Likes civs that do not compete with him for cavalry
Likes civs with high Loyalty, but dislikes those with low
Alpine Training: +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and no Movement penalty in Hill terrain.
+3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Hills
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus in Hills and Forest
Can escort moving civilian and support units at their higher [ICON_Movement] Movement speed.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus when fighting in Hill terrain.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]No [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty in Hill terrain.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus within 4 hexes of friendly territory.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Pillaging costs 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking defensible districts.
This unit's [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route cannot be plundered by enemy units. Obtained as part of an Economic Golden Age.
+15 Religious Combat Strength in friendly territory.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all melee attack units.
Grants +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to units starting their move up to 1 hex away.
Can Paradrop from friendly tile to location 7 tiles away (12 if starting from Aerodrome or Airstrip).
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength versus civilizations in a Golden Age.[NEWLINE]
Grants +5 [ICON_Bombard] Bombard Strength to Siege class units within 1 hex.
Ability to capture defeated cavalry units (Mongol Horde).
Being the original owner of the city
Being the owner of the city before occupation
Show the Loyalty of cities, and the sources of Loyalty that are influencing it.

Liberating a city will return it to one of their previous owners, possibly bringing that civilization back into the game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_WarmongerInfo}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This city will be immune to Loyalty pressure from your cities and governors.
Keep this city. You may want to move a [ICON_Governor] Governor here to strengthen the Loyalty of these new citizens joining your empire.

Refuse to let this city join your empire. It will remain a Free City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This city will be immune to Loyalty pressure from your cities and governors, and will not ask to join your civilization again. It could still be won over by a different civilization.
{Value : number +#;-#}% ({ActualValue : number +#.#;-#.#}) from Hwarang ([ICON_Governor] Governor with {1} {1 : plural 1?Promotion; other?Promotions;})
The citizens are Loyal to your civilization
The citizens' Loyalty to your civilization is wavering.
The citizens are disloyal to your civilization.
The citizens are in a state of unrest.
Governors[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View or manage [Icon_Governor] Governors in your civilization.
History Timeline[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View the timeline of Historic Moments achieved by your civilization.
This city is loyal to you, and there are no adverse effects.
[COLOR_RED]If Loyalty drops to 0, the city will rebel and join {1_PlayerName}, who has the most Loyalty accumulated here.
[COLOR_RED]If Loyalty drops to 0, the city will rebel and join the other civilization that has the most Loyalty accumulated here.
City Growth is at {1_GrowthReduction}%[NEWLINE]City Yields are reduced {2_YieldPercentage}%

You have a chance to join an Emergency against this Target.[NEWLINE]{1_GoalsExplanation}[NEWLINE]Succeed, and you will be rewarded. Fail, and the Target will grow stronger. You must Accept or Reject this Emergency.

An Emergency has been declared against you![NEWLINE]{1_GoalsExplanation}[NEWLINE]Successfully prevent the Members from taking these objectives, and you will be rewarded. Fail, and the Members will grow stronger.
Member civilizations split a pot of {1_Amount} [ICON_Gold] Gold.
The Target receives [ICON_Gold] {1_Amount} Gold per Member.
The Target gains +20 Loyalty per turn in the target city.
Those who join the Emergency will need to capture specific cities from {TargetName} within [ICON_Turn] {Turns} Turns.
Those who join the Emergency will need to capture {CityName} from {TargetName} within [ICON_Turn] {Turns} Turns.
The Members of the Emergency must capture specific cities from {TargetName}.
The Members of the Emergency must capture {CityName} from {TargetName}.
Defend {1_CityName} until the end of the Emergency.
Capture {1_CityName} before the end of the Emergency.
Those who join the Emergency will need to prevent {CityName} from following {TargetName}'s Religion for {HalfTurns} of the next [ICON_Turn] {Turns} Turns.
The Members of the Emergency must prevent {CityName} from following {TargetName}'s Religion for [ICON_Turn] {HalfTurns} Turns.
Prevent {NewReligion} from being the Dominant Religion in {1_CityName}.
Those who join the Emergency will need to liberate {CityName} from {TargetName}'s control within [ICON_Turn] {Turns} Turns.
The Members of the Emergency must liberate {CityName} from {TargetName}.
Defend {1_CityName} until the end of the Emergency.
Liberate {1_CityName} before the end of the Emergency.
"If we do not stand united, then the fate of this one city will come to us all in time."
{TargetName}, though at the forefront of the world's civilizations, has captured {OldCityName}. {TargetName}'s runaway success is a matter of great concern.
In addition, all Members will have Peace, Open Borders, and Shared Visibility with each other. All Members will go to War with the Target.
Member units gain +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement in the Target's territory.
Target units have -2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting Member units.
Member units gain +5 healing in the Target's territory.
Target gains +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking a Member unit with a City Strike.
"We honor the independence of City-States, and will not turn a blind eye to this conquest."
{TargetName} has captured {OldCityName}. The conquest of {OldCityName} is a matter of great concern.
All Members will have Peace, Open Borders, and Shared Visibility with each other. All Members will go to War with the Target.
Members gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn for each of their [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
Target [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to City-States grant +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn.
"The cries of the faithful rise to heaven, and on earth, we are moved to righteous fury."

{TargetName} has converted {OldCityName}, the Holy City of {OldReligion}, to {NewReligion}. It appears that {TargetName} is unwilling to co-exist peacefully with the other great Religions of the world.
The Target's Religion releases a burst of Pressure in all nearby cities.
Everybody spies, but this guy got caught! Let's do something about that!
Capture a Target Spy using Lay Trap in a City where the Target is doing an Operation.
Member Spies gain a new action in Member Cities: Lay Trap. If a Target Spy attempts an Operation in this City, they will be caught in the trap.
It will be more difficult for the Target to complete Spy Operations in Member cities.
"Hideous forces, employed to hideous ends. Never again!"
{TargetName} has used the most powerful weapon in the world, and the nuclear genie is out of the bottle. Is our extinction at hand?
In addition, all Members will have Peace, Open Borders, and Shared Visibility with each other. All Members will go to War with the Target.
Member units gain +1 [ICON_Movement] movement in the Target's territory.
Target units have -2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting Member units
Target units have -3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting Member units
Member cities exert one less Loyalty pressure.
"Open, honest war is surely less hateful than this deceitful diplomacy."
{TargetName} has struck a treacherous blow, declaring war on {OldPlayerName}, a long-time friend! It appears that none are safe from {TargetName}'s aggression.
In addition, all Members will have Peace, Open Borders, and Shared Visibility with each other. All Members will go to War with the Target.
Member units gain +1 [ICON_Movement] movement in the Target's territory.
Target units have -3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting Member units
All Trade Routes between the Members and the Target are canceled.
All Trade Routes between Members grant +2 [ICON_Production] Production.
Target units have -3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting Member units
The Target will receive reduced War Weariness when at war with Members.
reducing Loyalty and increasing our Loyalty
Forcing the top competitors to lose {1_EnvoyString}
Remove the enemy [ICON_Governor] Governor from duty for {1_TurnString}
Fabricate Scandal as if 2 levels more experienced.
Foment Unrest as if 2 levels more experienced.
Neutralize Governor as if 2 levels more experienced.
Broke a pledge to move troops from their border
Kept a pledge to move troops from their border
Decided to not make a pledge to move troops
Must be in friendly territory or adjacent to a Airstrip or Aerodrome.
Add [ICON_Production] Production to a project. Only once per city per turn.
The amount of Loyalty per turn towards your civilization that this Governor provides for the city.
The speed at which this Governor becomes established in a city.
Number of turns before the governor will be established.
Base strength as a Free City

Ranges from +20 to -20, based on the comparison of pressure coming from nearby [ICON_Citizen] Citizens belonging to the city's owner and nearby [ICON_Citizen] Citizens belonging to a different civilization.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]1 Pressure per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen normally[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increased in [ICON_Capital] Capital[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can be affected by Golden Ages, Dark Ages, and the Bread and Circuses city project[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Also applies to other cities within 9 tiles, but is 10% less effective per tile

Ranges from +20 to -20, based on the comparison of pressure coming from nearby [ICON_Citizen] Citizens belonging to the city's owner and nearby [ICON_Citizen] Citizens belonging to a different civilization.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]1 Pressure per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen normally[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increased in [ICON_Capital] Capital
You have converted a city to your founded Religion for the first time.
You have constructed a new District.
You have completed a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route.
You have discovered a new Continent or Natural Wonder.
You have destroyed a non-Barbarian naval unit.
You have constructed a building that provides [ICON_Science] Science as a base yield.
You have constructed a building with a Great Work slot.
You have constructed a building from the Industrial Era or later.
You have constructed a building in the Aerodrome district.
You have completed a successful offensive Spy operation.
You have earned a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.
Civilizations that have assigned their Diplomat [ICON_Governor] Governor to this city-state:
{1_CivName} has assigned a Diplomat to this city-state.
Review the new features in the current expansion.
City will fall to {1_CivName} when Loyalty reaches 0
Loyalty to {1_CivName} is Rising {2_PointsPerTurn} {2_PointsPerTurn : plural 1?point; other?points;} per turn
Loyalty to {1_CivName} is Falling {2_PointsPerTurn} {2_PointsPerTurn : plural 1?point; other?points;} per turn
Loyalty to {1_CivName} will not change next turn
Actively research the same Technology as your Research Ally to maintain a per-turn [ICON_Science] Science boost.
Receiving Level 3 Research Alliance Science Bonus.[NEWLINE]Researching the same Technology as your Research Ally maintains a per-turn [ICON_Science] Science boost.
City is fully Loyal and gaining Loyalty per turn

A [ICON_Governor] Governor unique improvement that can be built in a city with a Surveyor Governor with the Aquaculture promotion. Yields 1 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 additional [ICON_Food] Food if adjacent to a sea resource. Must be built on a coastal plot.

A [ICON_Governor] Governor unique improvement that can be built in a city with a Surveyor Governor with the Parks and Recreation promotion. Yields 2 Appeal and 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity if adjacent to water. Cannot be adjacent to another City Park.
Your Civilization may not declare a surprise war; this includes declaring war on a City State.
Your cities with Holy Sites exert pressure as if they were Holy Cities (4x Religion pressure on all cities within 10 tiles).
